wikitext.*:
'''Túrin''' means "he who desires mastery" in [[Sindarin]] (from ''[[tûr]]'', "mastery" or "lord" and ''[[ind]]'', "mood, desire, heart") and can refer to:
==Middle-earth==
* '''[[Túrin|Túrin Turambar]] ({{FA|464}} - {{FA|499|n}}), the tragic hero of the [[First Age]] who is the main protagonist of ''[[The Children of Húrin]]''.'''
* [[Túrin I]] ({{TA|2165}} - {{TA|2278|n}}), sixth [[Ruling Steward]] of [[Gondor]] who ruled during the [[Watchful Peace]].
* [[Túrin II]] ({{TA|2815}} - {{TA|2914|n}}), twenty-third [[Ruling Steward]] of [[Gondor]] whose reign marked the loss of [[Ithilien]].
